articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pakistan said India fired missiles at three air bases early on Saturday including one close to the capital, Islamabad, but Pakistani air defences intercepted most of them as the neighbours extended their worst fighting in nearly three decades.
articles.title: Pakistan says three air bases targeted by Indian missiles

articles.author: Aftab Ahmed, Fayaz Bukhari
articles.description: Pakistan's armed forces launched "multiple attacks" using drones and other munitions along India's entire western border on Thursday night and early Friday, the Indian army said.
articles.title: Pakistan launched multiple attacks along India's western border, India says

articles.author: Philip Pullella, Joshua McElwee, Keith Weir
articles.description: Pope Leo XIV on Friday celebrated his first Mass in the Sistine Chapel where he was elected less than 24 hours earlier and prayed that his historic papacy can help the Catholic Church be a beacon illuminating "the dark nights of this world".
articles.title: New Pope Leo XIV vows to bring light to world's "dark nights"

articles.author: Jonathan Landay, Jonathan Saul
articles.description: Iran is preparing to deliver in the near future launchers for short-range ballistic missiles that the U.S. said Tehran sent to Russia last year for use against Ukraine, according to two Western security officials and a regional official.
articles.title: Exclusive: Iran to send Russia launchers for short-range missiles, sources say

articles.author: Dmitry Antonov, Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russia marked the 80th anniversary of the Soviet Union's victory over Nazi Germany in World War Two on Friday with a major military parade that went off without any reports of Ukrainian attacks despite three years of devastating war.
articles.title: With Xi at his side, Putin marks WW2 victory as Ukraine war grinds on

articles.author: Doina Chiacu
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday an 80% tariff on Chinese goods "seems right," for the first time suggesting a specific alternative to the 145% levies he has imposed on Chinese imports ahead of closely watched weekend talks.
articles.title: Ahead of China-US talks, Trump says 80% tariff 'seems right'

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Andrew Hay, Alexandra Ulmer
articles.description: The split has grown wider in recent years as a growing segment of conservative Catholics becomes increasingly vocal and assertive.
articles.title: Warm American welcome for new pope masks US church's deep divide

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States and its European allies are finalising a proposal for a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine that if refused would see them jointly impose new sanctions on Russia, a French diplomatic source said on Friday.
articles.title: US, Europeans finalising 30-day Ukraine-Russia ceasefire proposal - diplomatic source

articles.author: Marco Aquino, Alexander Villegas
articles.description: The small city of Chiclayo in northern Peru was bustling with excitement on Friday, with businesses and locals sharing photos, memories and stories about its most famous former resident: Pope Leo XIV.
articles.title: In Peru's north, locals remember Pope Leo driving pick-up, playing tennis

articles.author: Will Dunham
articles.description: Bookish and reclusive jurist David Souter, who joined the U.S. Supreme Court as a supposed conservative "stealth nominee" but instead emerged as a liberal justice who backed abortion rights and dissented in the 2000 ruling that gave the presidency to Republican George W. Bush, died on Thursday at age 85.
articles.title: Former US Supreme Court Justice Souter dies
